text: this aunt as finicky as a cat is
cleaning its antenna it's a matter of
survival
dirty antennae don't pick up sense and
that's how ants navigate and communicate
so ants have evolved a great cleaning
mechanism and scientists in England have
figured out how it works a joint in the
front leg forms a kind of clamp with
scrub brushes and the ant pulls its
antennae through it
here's that brush mechanism up close the
electron microscope view with artificial
colors the leg is gold antennae pink
it's a bit like a car wash the antenna
goes through coarse bristles first
colored red that pick up the big
particles then through a fine comb lube
and then a very fine brush colored green
that gets the smallest particles of oil
the process works so well could be the
basis for nanotech cleaning devices or
it could be the basis for a children's
book the very very very clean end
